title: Heartwood Data & Interface Standards
description: Rules for ensuring the machine-readability, interoperability, and hierarchical proportionality of the firm's memory.

principles.name: Text as Universal Interface
principles.rule: Always prefer plain text (JSON, MD, CSV) for legislative state. Binary blobs are for external sync only.
principles.rationale: Machine-readable text ensures that all swarm generations can traverse the Heartwood without specialized tools.

principles.name: Hierarchy Proportion
principles.rule: Maintain shallow directory structures. Directory nesting must be proportional to data complexity.
principles.rationale: Excessive nesting leads to 'Context Friction' and metabolic slowdown. Consolidate fragments to reduce air.

principles.name: Polysemy Awareness
principles.rule: Avoid ambiguous terms like 'root', 'memory', or 'agent' without qualified context.
principles.rationale: In a multi-repo metagit, absolute precision in naming prevents 'Data Drift' and misinterpretation by successors.

principles.name: Atomization Principle
principles.rule: Split monolithic logs into individual timestamped JSON nodes for forensic searchability.
principles.rationale: Atomization improves metabolic efficiency and reduces the memory footprint of investigative queries.
